result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael K. Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay fine of $600.00  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
**  Submit to a DNA sample, if not previously submitted, and pay $250. DNA surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Angela Komp.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  4:15pm-  Matter heard with 14CF260.  Defendant sentenced to WSP for 36 months: 18 months initial confinement & 18 months extended supervision w/ conditions.  Credit for 113 days.  Court orders $600.00 fine plus costs & DNA surcharge.  DE to submit DNA sample (unless previously done).  DL revoked for 2 years.  Ignition interlock ordered for 2 years.  DE is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program & not eligible for CIP.  Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on May 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Due to ongoing jury trial (State v. Artis), 4/29/2014 Sentencing hearing is rescheduled to 5/8/2014 at 3pm.  NTBS by the Court.
from Krystal Orozco    (Copy sent to DA's Office & Attorney Komp on 3/28/2014)
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Angela Komp.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:33am-  Matter heard with 14CF260.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty; found guilty by the court.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.
from Steve Bluemel    (Copy sent to DA's Office & Attorney Komp on 3/7/2014)

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Angela Komp. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by ADA Krejcarek.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 3-13-14 @ 8:30am. Bond continued.

Def. has not been found to be eligible for SPD representation yet, due to equity in home not being verified yet, so def. does not have representation. Time limits tolled for cause. 1:30pm  Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards. Clerk:LE. Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days, scheduled for 01-24-2014 at 10:00am. $5,000 cash bond set with conditions (see bond event).

*Not to possess or consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  If released, Report to WCS by 11:00 the next business day; Submit to random UA's upon request.  Comply w/ all program requirements & provide all required information.  *No Contact w/ James M or his residence.
